intro: Tormentilla dissecta, commonly known as the dissected willow herb, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its slender, willow-like stems and finely divided, serrated leaves. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a valuable plant for ecological studies and habitat restoration.
